name: Canada's Most QUESTIONABLE Livery? Flair Airlines 737-800 Calgary to Vancouver
description:
Flair Airlines is a Canadian low-cost carrier that started up in 2005 as a charter airline. They began scheduled flights as “Canada’s Low Fare Airline” in 2017, with a fleet of 7 Boeing 737-400s.

Long story short, they rebranded again in February, opting for a more minimalistic look across the board, as well as this interesting new livery for their new 737-800s. It's grown on me quite a bit!

See what I thought of their 737-800 on this flight from Calgary to Vancouver!

Livery: New (2019)
Engines: 2x CFMI CFM56-7B24 
Registration: C-FFLJ
Route: Calgary (YYC) - Vancouver (YVR)
Callsign: FLAIR 301
Runway used: 35L (YYC) - 08L (YVR)
Date filmed: November 2019
